conclusion: Truck and bus are braking; need to find maximum distance between them.
Bus is in front of the truck, both start braking at the same time, initially 30 meters apart.
Velocity-time graph provided shows velocities over time.
Slope of v-t graph represents acceleration; area under curve gives displacement.
Truck's velocity decreases linearly from 40 m/s to 0 m/s between 0 and 20 seconds.
Bus's velocity decreases linearly from 30 m/s to 0 m/s between 0 and 30 seconds.
Find positions of vehicles as a function of time to determine maximum distance.
Truck's initial velocity is 40 m/s, final velocity is 0 m/s, time is 20 s, deceleration is -2 m/s².
Velocity of truck as a function of time: v_truck(t) = 40 - 2t.
Bus's initial velocity is 30 m/s, final velocity is 0 m/s, time is 30 s, deceleration is -1 m/s².
Velocity of bus as a function of time: v_bus(t) = 30 - t.
Integrate velocity functions to find position of each vehicle.
Initial position of truck is -30 m, bus is 0 m.
Position of bus as a function of time: s_bus(t) = 30t - (1/2)t².
Position of truck as a function of time: s_truck(t) = 40t - t² - 30.
Distance between vehicles at any time t: d(t) = 0.5t² - 10t + 30.
